Directives > ui-draggable/ui-droppable

ui-draggable

  • {{pop}}

<ul>
    <li ui-draggable="true" 
        drag="pop" 
        on-drop-success="dropSuccessHandler($event, $index, pop)" 
        drag-channel="pop" 
        ng-repeat="pop in popLegend">{{pop}}</li>
</ul>

ui-draggable options

Name type description
ui-draggable expression Expression that should be evaluated. The given expression should resolve to true or false.
drag variable Takes any JSON convertable $scope variable.
drag-handle-class string Class name used to mark child elements of draggable object to be used as drag handle.
If attribute is not present drag handle feature is not used.
If attribute is present but have no value drag-handle used as default.
on-drop-success function Takes any $scope function. Can also pass $event.
on-drop-failure function Takes any $scope function. Can also pass $event.
drag-channel string Takes a string that can be used as the channel name for the dragging operation. Default channel is "defaultchannel".

ui-droppable

  • {{rock}}

<ul ui-droppable="onDrop($event, $data, rockLegend)" drop-channel="rock, pop">
    <li ng-repeat="rock in rockLegend">{{rock}}</li>
</ul>

ui-droppable options

Name type description
ui-droppable function Takes any $scope function. Can also pass $event, $data and $channel.
drop-channel expression The channel on which the drop has to listen for drag events.
Single value, comma separated list or special value * are possible.
drag-enter-class string A class name that will be put on the droppable element when the dragged objects enters its boundaries.
Default class name is on-drag-enter.
drag-hover-class string A class name that will be put on the drop area when an element is dragged onto it.
Default class name is on-drag-hover.
